name: treatment of sewage sludge, 97% water, WWT, WW from particle board production, landfarming | sewage sludge, 97% water, WWT, WW from particle board production | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/27318/documentation

The process represents the treatment of a waste (sewage sludge) that is exclusively produced from another waste treatment. Sewage sludge is generated in the wastewater treatment (WWT) of 'wastewater from particle board production'. Recommended use of this dataset: to be used within the specific chain of treatments for 'wastewater from particle board production'. Share of biogenic carbon in the sludge: 98.98%.

The activity starts with the waste being available for landfarming. Collection and transportation of the waste to this process is not included.

The activity ends with the waste being treated and waste-specific emissions from the landfarming process are released to the environment (air, water and soil). The activity is considering local fate of emissions and the initial specific wastewater composition (generating the sewage sludge). Further, it includes provision of fertiliser functions for N, P, K, if present in the sludge.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The site has mean annual temperature (MAT) of 16.743579766537 degC, mean annual precipitation (MAP) of 1250.84108527132 mm/year, mean annual actual evaporation (EAT) of 460.58904958214 mm/year. Climate will influence the local fate emissions based on the elemental composition of the sludge as well as water evaporation to air (= consumptive water use).;References: UN data, 2020. Precipitation, Environment Statistics Database, United Nations Statistics Division Available at: http://data.un.org/Data.aspx?q=precipitation&d=ENV&f=variableID%3a6;;World Bank, 2022. Surface area (sq.km), World Bank Group Available at: https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/AG.SRF.TOTL.K2;;Doka G.,2021. A model for composition-specific life cycle inventories of regionalised wastewater fates, Zurich, Switzerland. http://www.doka.ch/publications.htm
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Landfarming is the process of spreading a substrate on agricultural soil. Sewage sludge is generated in the wastewater treatment of wastewater from particle board production. Spreading of liquid sewage sludge (97w% water content) on agricultural fields with mobile vacuum tanker.
